{"step_by_step_thinking": "The presence of a painless mass in the left testicle in a 10-year-old boy, along with elevated AFP levels, suggests a testicular germ cell tumor. The biopsy findings of glomeruli-like structures with a central capillary within a mesodermal core, lined by flattened layers of germ cells, are consistent with a yolk sac tumor. Yolk sac tumors are the most common testicular germ cell tumor in children and are associated with elevated AFP levels. Therefore, the most likely diagnosis in this patient is D. Yolk sac tumor.", "answer_choice": "D"}
